author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Federation of Tamil Nadu Agriculturists’' Associations on Thursday demanded lifting of ban on jallikattu. In case the ban is not lifted, the Federation would hold a black flag demonstration on the eve of Pongal at Kangeyam, Federation president S. Nallasamy, said while presiding over a discussion here.

The federation also called for deferment of the implementation of Seventh Pay Commission recommendations until a decision is taken on Federation president S. Nallasamy, recommendations of M.S. Swaminathan Committee for betterment of agriculture sector.

Speaking about plans to tap and market toddy throughout Tamil Nadu from January 21, Mr. Nallasamysaid the farmers would only be exercising their constitutional rights by carrying out the Act. A resolution was adopted at the meeting urging the Central Government to focus on tapping ethanol optimally from sugarcane. By another resolutions, the federation demanded extension of social security reflecting in pension to all senior citizens, an end to adulteration.
title: Farmers threaten black flag stir if ban on jallikattu is not lifted
